byline.contributor: Aleksandar Dimishkovski contributed reporting from Skopje, Macedonia, and Helene Bienvenu from Asotthalom, Hungary.

abstract: Tens of thousands of migrants and refugees are fleeing northward through Balkan countries, trying to reach richer havens of European Union; Hungary is building fence to deter desperate flow; fence, which is source of criticism, is seen as physical representation of crisis and absence of cooperation among EU nations trying to deal with situation.
lead_paragraph: On a chaotic path through the Balkans, tens of thousands of migrants are pushing to reach northern Serbia before Hungary seals the border.

headline.main: Migrants Race North as Hungary Builds a Border Fence
headline.print_headline: Migrants Race North as Hungary Builds a Fence

snippet: On a chaotic path through the Balkans, tens of thousands of migrants are pushing to reach northern Serbia before Hungary seals the border.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
